stance_1: I have been told to include protein in every meal
stance_2: I have meat with every meal
justification: The interviewee explicitly states that being told to include protein in every meal is a reason for having meat with every meal.

stance_1: I have been told to include protein in every meal
stance_2: I want to have protein, vegetables, and starch
justification: The interviewee links the advice about protein, vegetables, and starch to their meal-building approach.

stance_1: I enjoy the taste of steak
stance_2: I have meat with every meal
justification: Enjoying the taste of steak implicitly supports having meat with every meal, especially as steak is mentioned as a favorite.

stance_1: I stopped eating red meat for a period as a teenager
stance_2: Reading about meat by-products disgusted me
justification: The interviewee directly states that disgust from reading about meat by-products was the cause of stopping red meat consumption.

stance_1: I enjoy the taste of steak
stance_2: I stopped eating red meat for a period as a teenager
justification: Enjoying steak conflicts with having stopped eating red meat, as the interviewee resumed eating it due to the appealing taste.
